materials.raw_text: Cu: 100 g, Fe: 50 g, In: 40 g, Y: 10 g, O: 100 g (for oxidation)

sourcing.instructions: Cu: Copper metal from a hardware store or online metal supplier. Fe: Iron filings from a laboratory supply store. In: Indium metal from a specialized metal supplier. Y: Yttrium oxide from a chemical supplier. O: Oxygen can be sourced from air or through oxidation processes.
steps: Cu: Copper metal from a hardware store or online metal supplier. Fe: Iron filings from a laboratory supply store. In: Indium metal from a specialized metal supplier. Y: Yttrium oxide from a chemical supplier. O: Oxygen can be sourced from air or through oxidation processes.

1. Weigh each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry mortar and pestle, mix Cu, Fe, In, and Y powders until homogeneous. 3. Gradually add O powder to the mixture and continue to grind until a fine, even powder is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixed powder into a clean crucible.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry mortar and pestle, mix Cu, Fe, In, and Y powders until homogeneous. 3. Gradually add O powder to the mixture and continue to grind until a fine, even powder is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixed powder into a clean crucible.

steps: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 900 °C. 2. Once the temperature is reached, place the crucible inside the furnace. 3. Heat for 6 hours to ensure complete reaction of materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 900 °C. 2. Once the temperature is reached, place the crucible inside the furnace. 3. Heat for 6 hours to ensure complete reaction of materials.

steps: 1. After 6 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature, approximately 4-6 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to prevent oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 6 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature, approximately 4-6 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace until it has cooled completely to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. If necessary, use a diamond saw to shape the material to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and stability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. If necessary, use a diamond saw to shape the material to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and stability.
